block.p: Karen Taylor Savage and Joshua Adam Goldman were married in Manhattan on Thursday aboard a riverboat docked at the Intrepid Sea-Air-Space Museum in the Hudson River. Justice Joseph G. Golia of State Supreme Court in Queens officiated.

The bride, 37, was until December the chief clinical dietitian for Servicemaster, a food service company, at St. Vincent's Hospital and Medical Center in Manhattan. She graduated from the State University College at Cortland, N.Y., and received a master's degree in applied physiology and nutrition from Columbia University. Ms. Savage, who is keeping her name, is a daughter of Mary Savage of Larchmont, N.Y., and James Savage of Eugene, Ore.

Ms. Savage, who is keeping her name, is a daughter of Mary Savage of Larchmont, N.Y., and James Savage of Eugene, Ore.

The bridegroom, 42, is a vice president and broker at Loeb Partners Realty, a commercial real estate firm in Manhattan. He graduated from Ithaca College. His parents are Phyllis and Robert Goldman of Manhattan.
The couple met in August 1999, after a sailing event at the Indian Harbor Yacht Club in Greenwich, Conn., where Mr. Goldman, a yacht racer and club board member, was competing.
